newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar stock market posts gains in July.
newsitem.headline: Qatar stock market posts gains in July.

text.p: Shares at Qatar's official stock market posted good gains in the month of July coupled with a sharp rise in volumes, a statement by the Doha Securities Market (DSM) said on Sunday.
Of the 17 shares listed in the bourse, 14 rose, one declined and two were unchanged, DSM said in its monthly report.

"Trading volume in July rose by 29 percent to 138,332 shares compared with 107,067 shares in June and the value of traded shares increased by 46 percent to 28.5 million riyals ($7.83 million) against 19.5 million riyals," the report said.
It said the number of transactions showed a 46 percent improvement in July to 155 from 106 the previous month.
DSM was formally launched in May in line with plans to encourage private sector participation in the Gulf state's economy.
Banks accounted for 82 percent of the total trading value with 99,840 shares valued at 23.4 million riyals changing hands.

Market leader Qatar National Bank, gained 61 riyals in the month to close at 651 riyals, the Commercial Bank of Qatar closed 39 riyals higher at 370 riyals and Al Ahli Bank of Qatar ended 33 riyals better at 319 riyals.
Qatar General Insurance advanced 50 riyals to 550 and Qatar Insurance 40 riyals to 600.
In industrials, Qatar Cement jumped 55 riyals to 355 riyals and Qatar Flour Mills 35 riyals to 340 riyals.

Qatar Navigation added five riyals to 780 and Qatar Cinema 20 riyals to 225. Qatar Shipping and Qatar Industrial Manufacturing Company remained unchanged at 47 and 68 riyals respectively and Qatar Leisure shed one riyal to 51 riyals.
